title: Poster, Sutnar: Visual Design in Action/ The American Institute of Graphic Arts, 1961, printed later
title_raw: Sutnar: Visual Design in Action/ The American Institute of Graphic Arts
medium: offset lithograph on heavy, coated white wove paper
inscribed:
Upper portion in white on black:The American Institute of Graphic Arts presents"Sutnar: visual design in action", an exhibition on view - free at / the Pepsi-Cola Exhibition Gallery, 500 Park Avenue, NY, August 2 to 30 [Monday through Saturday, 9 am to 6 pm.] / originated by The Contemporary Arts Center, CIncinnati, in cooperation with Champion Papers of Hamilton, Ohio
The artist's name, Ladislav Sutnar, is placed vertically at upper right corner
description: The poster design is divided into two dominate areas. Across the top there is a black strip with white text and the artists name, and the bottom which is white with a large three part circular image.  The center portion of the image is a black capsule containing white geometric symbols. This is surrounded by a large white tilted "S" shape enclosed by a black circle.

participants.person_date: American and Czech, b. Pilsen, Bohemia, 1897, d. New York, New York, USA, 1976

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, Sutnar: Visual Design in Action/ The American Institute of Graphic Arts, 1961, printed later; Designed by Ladislav Sutnar (American and Czech, b. Pilsen, Bohemia, 1897, d. New York, New York, USA, 1976); offset lithograph on heavy, coated white wove paper; Sheet: 61 x 45.7 cm (24 x 18 in.); Gift of Unknown Donor; 1980-32-1119
